basics.name: Dr. Emily Carter
basics.label: General Physician
basics.summary: Board-certified general physician with over 8 years of experience providing patient-centered care in hospital and outpatient settings. Passionate about preventive medicine, clinical research, and leveraging technology to improve healthcare delivery.

work.name: St. Mary’s Medical Center
work.summary: Delivering general medical care to adult and pediatric patients; collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
highlights: Managed over 2,500 patient visits annually with a 96% patient satisfaction rate.
Led implementation of an electronic prescription system that reduced medication errors by 22%.
Mentored 5 resident doctors on diagnostic methodology and patient communication.

work.name: Bay Area Community Clinic
work.summary: Provided supervised medical care in the internal medicine department with exposure to emergency, outpatient, and chronic care units.
highlights: Conducted over 1,000 physical exams and preventive screenings per year.
Assisted in research on hypertension management published in the Journal of Internal Medicine (2017).

work.name: Bay Area Community Clinic
work.summary: Provided supervised medical care in the internal medicine department with exposure to emergency, outpatient, and chronic care units.
highlights: Conducted over 1,000 physical exams and preventive screenings per year.
Assisted in research on hypertension management published in the Journal of Internal Medicine (2017).

publications.name: Effective Hypertension Management in Community Clinics
publications.summary: Co-authored a study demonstrating 15% improvement in blood pressure control through structured lifestyle intervention.

awards.title: Excellence in Patient Care Award
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding dedication to patient outcomes and compassionate care.

projects.name: TeleHealth Pilot Program
projects.description: Led a hospital-wide pilot to implement remote patient monitoring and consultations during COVID-19 pandemic.
highlights: Served 600+ remote patients with 95% continuity of care.
Reduced in-person visits by 40% during lockdown while maintaining service quality.

references.name: Dr. Michael Roberts
references.reference: Department Head, St. Mary’s Medical Center — michael.roberts@stmaryshealth.org
